statement.tex: \text{Prove that the function }\\ \quad f(x) = \log\sin x \\ \text{is strictly increasing on }\left(0,\frac{\pi}{2}\right)\\ \text{and strictly decreasing on }\left(\frac{\pi}{2},\pi\right)

reason.tex: \log x \text{ makes sense only if }x\gt 0.\\ \therefore \log\sin x\text{ makes sense only when }\sin x\gt 0\implies x\in (0,\pi).
f'(x) = \cot x.\text{ And }\cot \gt 0 \text{ in the first quadrant}\\ \text{and }\lt 0\text{ in the second quadrant.}
